contentrichtext.text: '''Time and frequency transfer''' describes mechanisms for comparing measurements of [[time]] and [[frequency]] from one location to another. The technique is commonly used for creating and distributing standard time scales such as [[International Atomic Time]] (TAI). Examples of time and frequency transfer techniques include: *Simultaneous observation methods: ** Simultaneous [[carrier wave|carrier]] [[phase (waves)|phase]] observation of [[GPS]] signals ** Time transfer by simultaneous observation of [[Television|TV]] transmissions ** Time transfer by simultaneous observation of [[radio astronomy]] signals *Two-way transfer methods: ** [[Two-way satellite time and frequency transfer]] *Network methods: ** [[Network Time Protocol]] ** [[Precision Time Protocol]] ==See also== {{Portal|Time}} * [[Synchronization]] * [[Time transfer]] ==External links== * [http://www.metas.ch/en/labors/4/tvgps.html GPS and TV Time Comparison Techniques] * [http://www.boulder.nist.gov/timefreq/time/carrierphase.htm Time and Frequency Transfer using the phase of the GPS Carrier] * [http://tycho.usno.navy.mil/gpscp.html Global Positioning System Carrier-Phase] [[Category:Time]] [[Category:Telecommunications techniques]] [[Category:Synchronization]] {{Telecomm-stub}}
